# NSAccessibilityLayoutArea

**Protocol**

A role-based protocol that declares the minimum interface necessary for an accessibility element to act as a layout area.

## Declaration

```swift
protocol NSAccessibilityLayoutArea : NSAccessibilityGroup
```

## Overview

Use this protocol when you want to create a canvas that contains layout items.

You can further enhance the adopting element by implementing any of the information properties or action methods that the [doc://com.apple.appkit/documentation/AppKit/NSAccessibilityProtocol] protocol declares.



## Supporting Accessibility

- **accessibilityChildren()**: Returns the accessibility element’s children in the accessibility hierarchy.
- **accessibilityFocusedUIElement**: The child accessibility element with the current focus.
- **accessibilityLabel()**: Returns a short description of the layout area.
- **accessibilitySelectedChildren()**: Returns the layout area’s currently selected children.

## Layout Elements

- **NSAccessibilityLayoutItem**: A role-based protocol that declares the minimum interface necessary for an accessibility element to act as a layout item.
